_prev_prog_3.Description:
As a vital element of the facilityA?s prevention program, Sara Lee inaugurated  a Process Safety Management Program as mandated by OSHA Standard 29 CFR 1910.119.  Sara Lee has implemented strict preventive maintenance and operating procedures for the refrigeration system  in compliance with the Process Safety Management program. Additionally, the facility has developed an Emergency Action Plan where the release of ammonia is specially covered in the plan and contains all required actions in the event of a release of ammonia.
As part of the facility's prevention programs, emergency and operational training is conducted for employees and new hires.  Accidental release prevention, training and awareness are reinforced annually, and as operations at the facility dictates.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary



Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



Hillshire Brands Company, owns and operates a commercial bakery facility in Tarboro, North Carolina.  It is the policy of Hillshire Brands Co. to comply with all applicable federal, state and local environmental and safety laws and regulations, and to conduct its business in an environmentally sound manner that avoids any unreasonable adverse impact on the environment or its neighboring community.



In keeping with this policy, Hillshire Brands Co. has developed and implemented OSHA's Process Safety Management and EPA's Risk Management programs to ensure the safety of our employees and the surrounding community.  The Risk Management program includes procedures: (1) to identify potentially hazardous chemicals at the facility, (2) for maintaining a safe working environment and, thereby, help prevent the release of hazardous chemicals, and (3) for minimizing the consequences of a release should one occur.



Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled



Hillshire Brands Comapny's Tarboro facility makes frozen bakery products for public consumption .  The major processes at the Tarboro facility include flour handling and storage, ingredient mixing, dough proofing, product baking, product packaging and distribution.  Raw materials are delivered to this facility by trucks.



The only RMP regulated chemical handled by Hillshire Brands Co. at the Tarboro facility is anhydrous ammonia.  Anhydrous ammonia is used at the facility in the refrigeration system for cooling, and freezing products.  The anhydrous ammonia refrigeration system is a closed loop system.   Anhydrous ammonia is delivered to the facility by supplier tank trucks to initially charge the system and occasionally thereafter to top-off the system if needed, to replenish from periodic maintenance.  



Hillshire Brands Company has in place policies that limit the amount of ammonia at the facility.  In addition, this fa

cility complies with the ANSI/ASHRAE Standard 15 for ammonia refrigeration. This facility stores and handles 110,000 lbs of Anhydrous Ammonia at any given time.   





General Accidental Release Prevention Program and chemical Specific Prevention Steps



The Hillshire Brands Company Tarboro facility is subject to both EPA's Accidental Release Prevention program and OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) program.  Under both of these programs, the facility has outlined specific procedures that it follows to prevent or minimize the release of anhydrous ammonia to the environment.  Specifically, the facility has performed a process hazard analysis (PHA) of the ammonia system and will repeat this process at least every 5 years.  The purpose of the PHA is to provide a systematic approach for identifying, evaluating, and controlling potential hazards associated with the ammonia system.  In addition, the facility performs regular training of its employees to ensure that the procedures developed for the safe use and handling of ammonia is adhered to all the time.  Finally, the facility has a regular inspection and maintenance program to ensure that the ammonia system is operated and maintained according to specific ammonia industry safety standards.  

It is Hillshire Brands Coampny policy and belief that safe operating and maintenance practices and accident prevention programs are the key to obtaining safe operation and achieving accident prevention.





Five Year Accident History



Hillshire Brands Company's Tarboro facility has had one reportable release of ammonia in the last five years.  





Emergency Response Program



Hillshire Brands Co. has devised a comprehensive emergency response program, designed to protect both employees and the community in the event of a release. The Hillshire Brands Co. Emergency Response Policy focuses on evacuation of the facility in the event of an ammonia emergency, with the assistance of local emergency response agencies perform

ing rescue, firefighting, first-aid, medical treatment, and other response functions. The facility maintains a written Emergency Response Plan that documents specific procedures to be implemented in the event of various emergencies, including ammonia releases.  The Emergency Response Plan includes procedures for facility evacuation, as well as notification of the local emergency response agencies that are responsible for notifying the public. The plan is promptly updated to reflect any pertinent changes taking place within the facility that would require modified procedures.



Additionally Hillshire Brands Co. has trained on-site personnel to respond to accidental ammonia releases. These personnel are trained in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.120, Hazardous Operations and Emergency Response regulations according to their duties and functions. These personnel also receive initial training and annual update of training thereafter.   





Planned Changes to Improve Safety



No changes to the Hillshire Brands Co. ammonia refrigeration processes are planned at this time.   However, the processes will be subjected to regular process hazard analyses reviews for the purpose of identifying and implementing potential improvements. Facility personnel will also periodically review all potential opportunities to improve the safety of our personnel, the surrounding community, and the ammonia refrigeration process.
